name: Communication: Social Media in Action

prereqs.text: (73-270 [] at least D) or (70-340 [] at least D)

long_desc: Building upon what you already learned in Business Communications, this course will amplify your ability to successfully work in teams to produce social media content, collaborate via online mediums, and build online communication skills through development of an effective online presence. You will create and deliver social media content for your chosen organizations in this online space. This is a differentiator for you after this course, you will be able to go into an interview confidently and share your team experience helping the organization build a successful social media presence.

custom_fields.goals: Produce social media content, collaborate via online mediums, and build online communication skills through development of an effective online presence.
custom_fields.prerequisite_knowledge: Business communication skills competency from Business Communication (or related approved course) in audience analysis, adapting written, oral, and visual messages to diverse business or professional audiences, industry-focused research, persuasion, and ethical, responsible interpersonal communication skills.
custom_fields.assessment_structure: Graded assignments include team social media deliverables (blog/vlog, podcast, social media platform), team presentations, and peer-and self-assessments.
custom_fields.relevance: This course amplifies your ability to successfully work in teams to produce social media content, collaborate via online mediums, and build online communication skills through development of an effective online presence. Employees who communicate clearly, effectively, and can develop relationships with internal and external clients both in-person and online will thrive in these online environments. This course leads you through the development of creating effective social media platforms for your own team's organization.
custom_fields.learning_resources: Team and team/instructor meetings, possibly adding 1 hour to the expected weekly hours
custom_fields.extra_time_commitment: Course page in Canvas contains all resource
